snippet: Pocatello, a railroad town, welcomed a Chinese polysilicon factory with a land deal, banking on a high-tech future. But the company filed for bankruptcy.
abstract: Idaho railroad town Pocatello is struggling after pinning its hopes on filed Chinese polysilicon factory built by Hoku Materials that was to make materials for solar panels; plant rose up during recession in shimmering promise, gaining tax breaks and concessions, but has now filed for bankruptcy, dashing Pocatello's dreams of high-tech future.
lead_paragraph: Pocatello, a railroad town, welcomed a Chinese polysilicon factory with a land deal, banking on a high-tech future. But the company filed for bankruptcy.

headline.main: Idaho Town Struggles After Pinning Hopes on a Failed Factory
headline.print_headline: Idaho Town Struggles After Pinning Hopes On a Failed Factory
